title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 297.2 - Eligibility for use
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 297.2 - Eligibility for use

State Regulations
(a) State, Federal
and local government agencies or units, regulated public utilities, radio
common carriers, licensed radio and television broadcasting companies, and
volunteer public emergency service organizations shall be eligible to submit
requests to the Commissioner of General Services for permission to install
telecommunications facilities in or upon these buildings. Preferential
consideration shall be given to government agencies. Each request must include
the following information: (1)
name of the
organization submitting the request; (2)
type of equipment to be
installed; (3)
building in which
equipment is to be installed; (4)
purpose for which the equipment will be used; (5)
operating frequency(s); (6)
transmitter power output; (7)
antenna type, manufacturer and model
number; (8)
equipment space and
power requirements; (9)
station
call sign(s), if available; and
(10)
FCC file number, if
applicable. (b) Each
request shall be reviewed for electromagnetic compatibility with existing
systems, non-ionizing radiation hazards, space and power requirements, and
impact on total requirements. The requesting agency will be notified in writing
of the results of this review and, if the request is approved, the location and
space allocation for the installation. No installation work shall commence
without written approval of the Commissioner of General Services. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
297.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
